title: Senior Sales Engineer
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**



If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.



At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.



Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!



Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.

  


**The Work You'll Do:**



The Senior Sales Engineer will work with the Direct Sales and Alliance teams to provide technical support during the sales cycle for our relevant solutions within Sovos’ Indirect Tax Technology Suite (ITTS). The Senior Sales Engineer acts as the bridge between sales and product, professional services & support, utilizing technical expertise to support the sales team and deliver solutions that meet customer needs.



The Senior Sales Engineer will be adept at leveraging technical expertise to deliver innovative solutions, ensuring a seamless integration of product offerings with client needs. Also, this role possesses strong communication, enabling effective cross-functional collaboration and the successful execution of complex sales initiatives. Known for developing robust sales strategies, conducting impactful product demonstrations, and providing comprehensive technical support to both clients and internal sales teams. The Senior Sales Engineer will report to the Sales Engineering Manager – Europe.


*More specifically you will:*


* Provide superior domain expertise around ITTS solutions
* Maintain expert level understanding of functionality and technical architecture of our products
* Assist in the client discovery process to help uncover unforeseen challenges and desired solution architecture. Also conduct reviews of discovery questionnaires to ensure customer landscape knowledge is documented and any other sales opportunities are identified
* Develop a firm understanding of customer needs, pain points, and requirements around the ITTS and align Sovos solutions to fulfill the needs and requirements to eliminate the pain
* Work closely with Sovos’ Sales to conduct sales and solutions presentations
* Collaborate with Professional Services and product functions to ensure a successful onboarding post sale
* Maintain and continually improve demonstration capabilities in order to be able to present to customers a compelling and coherent narrative as to the key features and benefits of Sovos solutions
* Conduct in-depth technical presentations and product demonstrations to prospects and clients.
* Act with integrity and demonstrate ethical behavior in all matters with all stakeholders
* Take full responsibility for ensuring internal and external customer satisfaction
* Demonstrate a high degree of self-awareness and commitment to personal development and learning
* Focus on process improvement, adept at optimizing sales workflows and driving efficiency to enhance revenue growth and customer satisfaction.
* Develop and lead training sessions both within and outside the Sales Engineer department
* Serve as a subject matter expert surrounding the creation of RFP and RFI responses for prospective new clients
  

**What We Need From You:**


* Bachelor’s in related field, or equivalent combination of experience and education
* Minimum 6 years of Sales Engineer experience or equivalent
* Ability to be strategic towards business outcomes as well as manage and handle day-to-day details and deadlines
* Strong team orientation with a history of working collaboratively in a fast paced environment
* Ability to manage multiple projects at once and prioritize activities
* Thorough knowledge of MS Office software including Excel, Word, & Power Point
* Well-developed business ethics and the ability to maintain a high level of discretion
* Self-motivated and strong drive to succeed
* Solid knowledge on different communication protocols (e.g. APIs, SFTP, AS2 etc. as well as different delivery formats (e.g. IDOC, EDIFACT, XML, UBL etc).
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
* Multiple language skills preferred
* Moderate travel required for client meetings, trade shows, Sovos Events, and special projects
* Essential Job Functions:
	+ Interact effectively with teammates, colleagues and customers
	+ Comprehend and communicate complex concepts
	+ Concentrate, analyse and resolve complex problems
	+ Utilise technology (e.g. phone systems, computer hardware and software applications) to fulfil work requirements

**What Does Sovos Offer You?**


The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!


* An opportunity to work with a global team
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days!
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognised Training and Development programs
* Benefits

*Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, color, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.*

  

**Company Background**


Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.


More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

  

#LI-Remote
company_description: Sovos is a global SaaS company capable of meeting your regulatory compliance needs anywhere you do business.

title: Power BI Data Analyst – (50% remote)
description:
We are looking for an experienced Power BI Data Analyst to join our team and assist in the development of tools and dashboards for data visualization and reporting. The selected consultant will be responsible for the following tasks:
  
– Design, implement, and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards and reports tailored to meet the specific needs of the business.
  
– Extract, transform, and analyze data from diverse sources to provide meaningful insights.
  
– Collaborate closely with key stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into actionable data-driven solutions.
  
– Optimize Power BI solutions for scalability, performance, and user experience.
  
– Provide training and create documentation to ensure that internal teams can effectively utilize Power BI for reporting and analysis.
  
  

**Work Environment:**  

Hybrid – 50% in the office and 50% onsite in Södertälje.
  
  

**Education Requirements:**  

– Bachelor’s degree or higher in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Business Intelligence, or a related field.
  
– Power BI certifications or certifications in similar data visualization tools are highly preferred.
  
  

**Required Skills and Experience:**  

– Proficiency in both Swedish and English, both spoken and written.
  
– Strong experience with DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and Power Query (M).
  
– Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL is considered an advantage.
  
  

**Desirable Qualifications:**  

– Proven experience in a Data Analyst or similar role focused on Power BI development.
  
– Knowledge of advanced analytics, predictive modeling, or integration of machine learning with Power BI.
  
– Experience working with cloud platforms like Azure or AWS.
  
– A solid understanding of database systems and ETL processes.
  
– Familiarity with business processes and KPIs, ideally within the context of TRATON/Scania.
  
This is a great opportunity for individuals passionate about data visualization, with the ability to turn complex data into insightful business solutions.

title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Description
  
Position at Wind River
  
ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY
  
  

Wind River is a leader in delivering software for the intelligent edge. This role requires the understanding and delivery of the technical requirements of major networking and telecom operators. You will leverage Wind River’s Cloud Platform to deliver geographically distributed, high-performance, production grade Kubernetes-based solutions for managing edge cloud infrastructure. Optimized for the network edge, the solutions you will support address service provider’s complex challenges of deploying and managing a physically distributed, cloud native infrastructure.
  
You must have experience in software engineering with a strong focus on Telecom and data networking. Yu will need to apply your technical expertise, passion for open source to understand the customer’s problems and develop solutions using our product offerings and services.
  
  

A qualified candidate is expected to be hands-on in the deployment of Wind River’s Cloud platform, extending product features, working with hardware, and testing code. Experience in open-source projects such as Ansible, Python, OpenStack, StarlingX, Git and Markdown is a benefit.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

Provide technical guidance and delivery of projects based on Wind River’s Cloud Platform to Communication Service Provider (CSP) customers.
  
Work with Professional Services Project Managers to prepare project descriptions, identify task lists, set schedules, determine engineering hours, estimate project risk and deliver on successful bids.
  
This is a direct customer facing position and requires comfort with customers and issue resolution.
  
Some travel may be required.
  
  

ABOUT YOU
  
  

This is a direct customer facing position and requires comfort with customers and issue resolution.
  
You are authoritative in your decision making and drive solutions, based upon service management essentials.
  
Enjoy working on leading edge technologies and projects.
  
Expertise in Kubernetes, Docker, Elastic, Kafka, and cloud-native technologies (Type-1 and Type-2).
  
Strong Problem-solving skills based upon a myriad of differing scenarios (Network/performance/hardware)
  
Ability to replicate customer issues in a Wind River lab
  
Ability to think laterally
  
Storage configuration expertise such as RAID/Ceph/NFSv3+v4 (on NetApp a plus).
  
Strong knowledge of Compute Cluster concepts.
  
Working/functional knowledge of network stacks, switching, routing, etc.
  
An understanding of how to integrate into Assurance systems.
  
Be comfortable with building, reconfiguring and provisioning lab equipment such as servers physical and virtual routers and networks (including IPv4/6) in both Wind River and customers’ lab environments. BMC configurations (iDRAC/ILO/IPM/Redfish).
  
Experience in network system-level solution design.
  
Exposure to SDN concepts, Network Function Virtualization (NFV), and ETSI-MANO.
  
Linux (Debian, Ubuntu) background covering deployment, image build, application, and administration.
  
Adept at Python and automation languages like Ansible.
  
The ability to work on a team & independently on multiple high priority projects.
  
Be willing to work in an ambiguous environment and willing to self-learn.
  
Verbal communications via articulation of past project details desired outcomes and written communication skills.
  
Organizational and interpersonal skills, plus proven relationship building abilities.
  
  

Qualifications
  
  

Bachelor of Science in Electrical or Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent.
  
Cloud based certification (AWS/Azure/GCP), or Kubernetes certs - CKA/CKSS/CKAD
  
4 years of relevant work experience.
  
  

Wind River is an Equal Opportunity Employer with a commitment to diversity. We prohibit discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation or any other legally protected status.

title: Power BI Data Analyst
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 4+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
  

**Rollbeskrivning:**  

AssignmentWe are seeking a skilled Power BI Data Analyst to support our organization in developing tools anddashboards for data visualization and reporting. The consultant will: • Design and implement interactive Power BI dashboards and reports tailored to businessneeds.• Extract, transform, and analyze data from various sources.• Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them intoactionable insights.• Ensure scalability, usability, and performance optimization of Power BI solutions.• Provide training or documentation to enable internal teams to use Power BI efficiently.Where will the assignment be performed (Onsite, Hybrid, offsite)Hybrid 50% office and 50% onsite in Södertälje. Education• Bachelor’s degree or higher in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, BusinessIntelligence, or a related field.• Certifications in Power BI or similar data visualization tools are highly desirable. Language• Proficiency in Swedish and English, both written and spoken.• Experience with DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and Power Query (M) is required.• Familiarity with programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL is a plus.Meriting• Previous experience as a Data Analyst or similar role focusing on Power BIdevelopment.• Knowledge of advanced analytics, predictive modeling, or machine learningintegration with Power BI.• Experience in working with cloud platforms such as Azure or AWS.• Strong understanding of database systems and ETL processes.
  
  

Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
  
Arbetsplats och kulturVi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
  
Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: SRE Engineer
description:
ECARX is a global mobility-tech company partnering with OEMs to reshape the automotive landscape as the industry transitions to an all-electric future. As OEMs develop new vehicle platforms from the ground up, ECARX is developing a full stack solution – central computer, System-on a chip (SoCs) and software to continuously improve the in-car user experience. The company’s products have been integrated into more than 5 million cars worldwide and continues to shape the interaction between people and vehicles advancing the technology at the heart of smart mobility.
  
Position overview
  
Join our dynamic SRE team in Gothenburg as a Senior Site Reliability Engineer, where you'll be at the forefront of building a resilient AWS cloud infrastructure for groundbreaking automotive technologies. This role is about technical excellence, innovation, and contributing to a collaborative environment that values diversity and continuous improvement. You'll be a key technical expert, driving infrastructure reliability, automation, and performance for our cutting-edge automotive solutions.
  
Key Responsibilities
  
Design and implement scalable, secure AWS cloud infrastructure using advanced tools like CloudWatch and AWS Config.
  
Lead technical automation and orchestration projects, utilizing AWS CloudFormation, AWS CDK, and Lambda to enhance system efficiency.
  
Develop and maintain robust, fault-tolerant cloud applications and services through deep technical expertise.
  
Proactively identify and address system scalability challenges, leveraging advanced AWS solutions.
  
Contribute to incident management processes, bringing technical depth and problem-solving skills to complex challenges.
  
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure optimal system performance and reliability.
  
Stay current with AWS technologies and emerging trends, proposing innovative technical solutions.
  
Support team knowledge sharing and contribute to the technical growth of the engineering group.
  
Required qualifications
  
Bachelor's or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, or related fields
  
Minimum 5 years of experience in site reliability engineering
  
Advanced skills in AWS services and infrastructure-as-code tools
  
Strong proficiency in scripting and automation technologies
  
Expert-level understanding of networking, security, and distributed systems within AWS environments
  
Proficiency in monitoring tools like CloudWatch and CloudTrail
  
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in diverse, cross-functional teams
  
Technical Expertise Required
  
Deep knowledge of AWS cloud infrastructure
  
Advanced scripting skills (Python, Bash, etc.)
  
Experience with infrastructure as code
  
Strong understanding of cloud security principles
  
Proven track record of implementing scalable system architectures

title: Data Scientist
description:
In a world where product size labels are unreliable, Volumental is the footwear industry's leading FitTech company, using 3D scans and a one-of-a-kind, AI-powered recommendation engine to match everyone with the shoes that fit them best.


Our vision is “a world without sizes, where every body fits.” With top brand and retail partners across the world including New Balance, Fleet Feet, XXL, The Athlete’s Foot, Red Wing Shoes, Intersport and Crocs, our footprint spans 3000+ stores across 58 countries, and growing! To date, we’ve gathered more than 60 million foot scans.


Our online product enables e-commerce sites to help their shoppers find the best-fitting footwear through our size-guiding tool. The product has experienced rapid growth and is now being used by almost 100,000 shoppers every month. This means we have to quickly leverage data insights, both to show how we impact our customers' KPIs, as well as to learn about our end users so we can keep iterating and improving our product.

 **Who you will work with**


We are working in cross-functional product teams with a strong product development focus. Our team values collaboration, creativity, and a passion for innovation. We have an inclusive environment where everyone's ideas are heard and respected. Every team member has strong agency and is expected to have a holistic mindset on what needs to be done. Our work environment thrives when there is open, respectful discussion and the best (data-driven) ideas win.


If you like being part of the early stages of product development and working alongside technically skilled and motivated colleagues, this is your opportunity.

 **What you will work on**


Our goal is to enable shoppers to simplify their purchasing decisions online, help them find the best size, and in the end decrease fit-related returns. To measure the impact and improve our product we collect a lot of different data points, some of which are:

* How shoppers use our product, and where they drop off, as well as ask for feedback on the experience.
* Mobile scans and fit preferences to generate footwear recommendations.
* Orders and returns from our customers to be able to measure the impact of the product, like conversion and return rates.


As a Data Scientist within our online product making sense of this data will be one of your primary objectives. And, in close collaboration with the Product Manager and the whole team, you will:

* Translate data into actionable insights, for your team and our customers.
* Promote a data-driven mindset within the team, defining priorities and guiding best practices when it comes to methodology and technology.
* Develop dashboards and visualize key metrics to help our customers understand how we impact their business.
* Design, conduct, and evaluate A/B tests to improve the user experience.
* Maintain and evolve our data pipelines.
* Tackle a variety of exciting challenges as we grow!


Some of the tools you will be using to accomplish this are BigQuery, SQL, Dataform, Python, and Amplitude. We run our products on Google Cloud Platform.

 **We are excited about you because:**

* A self-motivated and collaborative team member.
* Curious and passionate about solving challenging problems.
* Open to teaching others and learning new things.
* Keen to work in a caring scale-up environment.

**We expect you to:**

* Have strong collaboration skills for working with cross-functional teams.
* Be a self-starter who can independently manage initiatives and drive them forward.
* Have a Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as computer science, physics, statistics, or similar.
* Be able to communicate complex insights effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
* Be proficient in SQL and Python for data analysis.

**Bonus - Not required but nice to have, absolutely let us know if you have experience with any of the following:**

* Have 2+ years of professional experience working as a data scientist/engineer.
* You have experience with e-commerce platforms, optimizing site performance and user experience through analyzing key business metrics.
* You have worked with data pipeline tools like Dataform, DBT, or similar.
* You have experience working with Google Cloud Platform.

**What we can offer you:**

* Personal learning budget and access to coaching
* Opportunity to work with a great team of 20+ nationalities in our English-speaking office
* Occupational pension at ITP1 level
* Flexible Public Holidays Policy
* Options Program
* Parental pay top-up
* Wellness allowance
* Dog-friendly office

Hybrid work policy (at least 2-3 days from our Stockholm office)  
* 

Join Volumental and be part of a team that's transforming the footwear industry with data-driven solutions. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to make a tangible impact on our product and our customers' success while growing your skills in a supportive environment.

title: Senior Enterprise Account Manager
description:
External Description:
**Build Your Career at Informatica**
------------------------------------


We're looking for a diverse group of collaborators who believe data has the power to improve society. Adventurous, work-from-anywhere minds who value solving some of the world's most challenging problems. Here, employees are encouraged to push their boldest ideas forward, united by a passion to create a world where data improves the quality of life for people and businesses everywhere.


**Senior Enterprise Account Manager, Nordics (Stockholm based)**
----------------------------------------------------------------


**Informatica** is looking for a **Senior Enterprise Account Manager** with experience selling Enterprise business software to join our team in Stockholm, Sweden**.**


You will report to the **Senior Regional Sales Director**


The Account Manager will sell our strategic enterprise software Data solutions and driving incremental subscription & cloud revenue. In the role of Territory Account Manager, you will maintain relationships within assigned accounts and maximize Informatica's footprint within them. We are looking for knowledge of complex organizational challenges and being able to translate these into Data Solutions that drive agreed outcomes. Your character is based on tenacity, grid, perseverance and a will to drive our customers' success.


**Your Role Responsibilities? Here's What You'll Do**
-----------------------------------------------------


* You are responsible for the execution plan of each assigned account.
* Develop a strategic and comprehensive business plan for your accounts, including identifying core customer requirements and mapping the benefits of Informatica's solutions to customer requirements and agreed outcomes.
* Sell-to and work with executive-level customer decision-makers up to and including the CXO level.
* Accountable for accurate forecasting in SFDC, qualifying against our MEDDICC methodology, regular quarterly revenue delivery and the implementation of agreed account and business plans.
* Developing your own pipeline for the shorter and longer-term requires taking ownership to create new opportunities yourself and to maximize this you work with our Strategic Partners and Marketing to develop an plan for the accounts, to include events, seminars, and roadmap sessions.

**What We'd Like to See**
-------------------------


* 5+ years of experience in a Field Sales role and selling Enterprise Software solutions.
* Relevant Bachelors or Master's degree.
* Industry knowledge of Business Services Accounts.

**Role Essentials**
-------------------


* Experience hitting sales targets.
* Deep industry knowledge of a customer's decision-making process, goals, strategies, and goals.
* In-depth understanding of the power of Data and its impact on data-driven decisions.
* BA/BS or equivalent educational background, we will consider an equivalent combination of relevant education and experience
* Minimum 5+ years of relevant professional experience

**Perks & Benefits**
--------------------


* Comprehensive health, vision, and wellness benefits (Paid parental leave, adoption benefits, life insurance, disability insurance and 401k plan or international pension/retirement plans
* Flexible time-off policy and hybrid working practices
* Tuition reimbursement program to support your and personal growth
* Equity opportunities and an employee stock purchase program (ESPP)
* Comprehensive Mental Health and Employee Assistance Program (EAP) benefit

We're guided by our DATA values and we are passionate about building and delivering solutions that accelerate data innovations. At Informatica, we know diversity drives innovation. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer dedicated to maintaining a work environment free from discrimination, one where all employees are treated with dignity.


Informatica (NYSE: INFA), an Enterprise Cloud Data Management leader, brings data to life by empowering businesses to realize the transformative power of their most critical assets. We have pioneered the Informatica Intelligent Data Management Cloud™ (IDMC) that manages data across any multi-cloud, hybrid system, democratizing data to advance business strategies. Customers in over 100 countries and 85 of the Fortune 100 rely on Informatica. www.informatica.com. Connect with LinkedIn, Twitter, and Facebook. **Informatica. Where data comes to life.**

title: Grafisk Designer till Motonet
description:
Vill du vara med och bidra til Motonets framgång i Sverige? Vill du utveckla dina färdigheter och bidra med tankar och idéer som blir till verklighet? Då är det här jobbet för dig!


Vi söker en kreativ och driven grafisk formgivare som vill vara med och stärka vår närvaro i Sverige samt förbättra kundengagemanget. I denna roll kommer du vara delaktig i produktionen av både tryckt och digitalt innehåll, inklusive reklamblad, printannonser, butiksmaterial, banners, rörlig grafik och innehåll för sociala medier.

**Huvudsakliga ansvarsområden**

* Skapa och producera tryckt och digitalt material i enlighet med företagets koncept, riktlinjer och värderingar
* Bidra till det kreativa utbytet inom teamet och säkerställa att allt innehåll håller hög kvalitet
* Agera lojalt och korrekt mot företaget samt följa företagets mål och affärsplan
* Delta i personlig utveckling och säkerställa en trygg och säker arbetsmiljö

**Kvalifikationer**

* Relevant utbildning inom grafisk formgiving, jobberfarenhet är inte ett krav men meriterande
* Erfaren användare av Adobe Creative Cloud samt Microsoft Office
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både muntligt och skriftligt
* Som person är du noggrann, strukturerad, kundorienterad, lösningsorienterad, självmotiverad, resultat- och målstyrd
* Du är villig att ta dig an uppgifter utanför din arbetsbeskrivning för att skapa framgång för bolagets marknadsföring och generella utveckling

**Varför ska du välja Motonet?**


Motonet är ett starkt och välmående bolag som drivs av den familjeägda och nästan 60 år gamla koncernen Broman Group. Du kommer omfattas av Handelns kollektivavtal för tjänstemän. Kompensation och förmåner utgår som minst enligt branschstandard.

* Friskvårdsbidrag, tjänstepension och förtroendearbetstid
* Resultatbaserad bonus
* En möjlighet att bidra till Motonets verksamhet och expansion i Sverige
* En dynamisk och kreativ arbetsmiljö med möjlighet att påverka och utvecklas
* Möjlighet att arbeta med internationella projekt och bidra till företagets expansion
* Stöd och resurser för personlig och professionell utveckling

**Rekryteringsprocessen**


Låter detta intressant? Vi kommer att hantera ansökningarna löpande och när vi hittar rätt person kan det gå fort till signering, så se till att skicka in din ansökan direkt! Sista ansökningsdag är 12 januari 2025. Du kommer att bli kontaktad oavsett om du går vidare i processen eller inte.  

  

Har du några frågor om tjänsten eller processen, vänligen kontakta rekryteringsansvarig Anna Hermansson på anna.hermansson@motonet.se.


Varmt välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!

*Vill du veta mer om Motonet? Klicka dig in på våra karriärsidor:* *Jobba på Motonet - Motonet Sverige*

title: Hyper Automation Enablement Lead
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------

 **About this opportunity**


Enterprise IT is a function hosted in Group Function Global Operations with the aim to shape and execute our digital strategy, vision and to ensure cross-functional execution. Enterprise Automation platforms is a key enabler in driving radical transformation and Enterprise IT continues to build up best in class platforms in this area to enable business transformation.  

  

We are now looking for Hyper Automation Enablement Lead for executing the vision and direction to enable the Enterprise IT to achieve strategic technology and business objectives through Hyper Automation initiatives.

  

This role is key to the Enterprise Automation Platforms unit and should work in collaboration with other Product areas and enablement functions within EIT.  

  

The ideal candidate should have relevant experience in managing large transformation initiatives in matrix organization leveraging Cloud, Integration, Analytics, Automation & AI capabilities.

 **What you will do**

* This role will be responsible for Enabling/tracking Enterprise IT Hyper Automation Transformation Roadmap.
* Collaborate with internal stakeholders/partners to identify the scope, boundaries for IT transformation/cost optimization.
* Establish and track key metrics for monitoring performance/efficiency of identified transformation initiatives
* Provide advice on best practices and approaches to technology teams and internal business stakeholders
* Facilitate/Lead critical discussions across different lines, addressing issues and providing optimal solutions.
* Assess risks associated with transformation initiatives, develop mitigation strategies in collaboration with transformation stream owners, and provide guidance to mitigate potential issues or roadblocks.
* Collaborate cross areas with business stakeholders, IT colleagues and partners to ensure transformation scope deliverables
* Communication and engagement to ensure successful hyper automation enablement centre adoption.
* Provide Hyper Automation enablement updates, Transformation workstreams updates and outcomes to EIT leadership and other key stakeholders
* Stay up to date with emerging technology trends, industry best practices, and advancements in IT transformation methodologies, and propose innovative ideas to enhance IT/business efficiency and effectiveness.

 **The skills you bring**

  

Key Qualifications

* 10+ years of experience required: Expert in leading and directing IT transformations delivery.
* Previous experience managing matrixed vendor relationships and holding vendors accountable for outcomes
* Proven track record of successfully delivering results in a highly matrixed role, working to influence and align cross-functional teams with competing priorities.
* Skilful at navigating ambiguity. Thrives in fast-paced environment.
* Analytical skills and being able to interact with senior leaders across Technology and Business
* Excellent motivation skills, being both self-motivated & self-directed with ability to deliver outcomes to strict deadlines and able to motivate others at all levels

  

Additional Requirements

* IT processes, tools and infrastructure knowledge.
* Agile mindset and ways of working
 **Application**  

We look forward to your application with CV in English.  

Last day to apply: 23th of December 2024 (Selection will take place in January 2025)  

Location: Stockholm, Sweden  

Flexibility of work: We target 60% attendance at office.  

We provide flexible working at Ericsson and our preference for a role that involves partnership, collaboration and design is that productive conversations happen in the office. Therefore, we ask teams to be present at least three days a week.

  

Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.

  

If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Nina Juthage, Sr. Recruiter, at nina.a.juthage@ericsson.com

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

  



If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com

  

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm

title: Piping Engineer, with Aveva Admin skills
description:
The European Spallation Source ERIC (ESS) is one of the largest technology infrastructure projects being built today, and aims to be the most powerful neutron source in the world when it is fully operational in 2028. It will enable scientists to study the structure and behavior of matter at the atomic level, opening new possibilities for research and innovation in material science.


**About the role**



We are now seeking to appoint a Piping Engineer with Aveva Admin skills for the Plant & Process Engineering Function, which is part of the Design & Engineering Division. The team is responsible for the specification and design of process systems, such as cooling systems, associated piping systems and mechanical support systems. Configuration and support of the Aveva tool suite, and engineering reviews and support, are also part of the tasks of the group.



This dual-role opportunity is perfect for professionals eager to apply their industry experience to a project of historic importance.



The main areas of responsibilities associated to the Aveva platform are:


* Configuring and setting up the Aveva E3D environment including:
	+ Project templates
	+ User roles
	+ Permissions
	+ Project-specific settings
	+ Catalogues & specifications for piping, electrical and Aveva supports
	+ Diagram symbols and templates
* Customizing and configuring the Aveva E3D software to meet the specific needs and requirements of the organization, including customizing user interfaces, workflows, and reports.
* Providing support to engineering teams by assisting with project setup, data management, and troubleshooting issues related to the Aveva E3D software.
* Providing technical support and troubleshooting assistance to users encountering issues with the Aveva E3D software, diagnosing problems and implementing solutions.
* Providing ESS standards and best practices within piping design and Aveva tool. Developing training materials and documentation to onboard new users and train existing users on the use of the Aveva software.
* Identifying the need for additional support provided by Aveva and plan and follow-up deliveries.


The main areas of responsibilities associated to piping design and engineering are:


* Performing pre-studies, conceptual, system design and detailed design of piping systems and associated mechanical support systems.
* Preparing specifications and documentation for procurement, fabrication and installation of systems and components.
* Supporting in the manufacturing process, installation, testing and commissioning of equipment and systems.


This is a permanent position with a six-month probationary period. It is an on-site position in Lund, Sweden, and we need someone who can start as soon as practically possible.


**About you**



To thrive in this role, we believe that you have a relevant engineering degree, or education and experience that we deem relevant for the role, such as experience from industrial plants or equivalent. You have a minimum of five years’ working experience from the tasks mentioned above, and your knowledge on components, dimensioning, standards and directives, as well as the installation process, is good.



Proficiency in the Aveva tool suite is a requirement. It is also beneficial if you have worked professionally as an Aveva Administrator before, but we would be willing to train a candidate who fulfils other requirements. Furthermore, proficiency in written and spoken English is a requirement.



We believe that you enjoy communicating and collaborating with a large number of primarily internal stakeholders. You are comfortable with being the Aveva Admin go-to person in the organisation, and feel confident in preparing and conducting staff trainings, in a pedagogical and patient manner.



Ideally, you are a self-motivated problem-solver, striving to ensure smooth and efficient ways of working for the organisation. Being structured and taking responsibility while adhering to instructions and procedures comes naturally to you.


**What can we offer?**



Aside from the chance to work at a truly unique Big Science project, you can also expect:


* A stunning, brand new workplace filled with innovative minds and brilliant people.
* A challenging and stimulating work environment.
* 30 days of annual leave, as well as more than 10 days of public holiday and company days off or days with limited working hours.
* Monthly pension contributions on top of your salary.
* Focus on work-life balance.
* Preventative healthcare benefit.
* Where applicable, relocation support and allowances may also be available.


**Interested? We sure hope so.**



If you see yourself in what we’re looking for, please provide your CV and motivation letter in English . Please be aware that we can only accept direct applications made via the ESS website. We will review applications and also interview continuously, so please apply as soon as you can, or by 14 January, 2025 at the latest.



Certain roles at ESS require health and safety and/or security checks, which may be carried out during the recruitment process.



For more information regarding the ESS recruitment process, please see https://europeanspallationsource.se/careers or contact Recruitment Officer Åsa Ander at asa.ander@ess.eu



For further information regarding the position, please contact Mats Pålsson at mats.e.palsson@ess.eu



For trade union information, please contact Unionen representative Mikael Johansson at mikael.johansson@ess.eu or SACO/Swedish Association of Graduate Engineers representative Marc Kickulies at marc.kickulies@ess.eu


*We look forward to receiving your application!*

title: GEOTECHNICAL DESIGN ENGINEER SOUTH JUTLAND/STOCKHOLM AREA , DENMARK/SWEDEN
description:
#### **Passionate about Engineering - RDT Engineers**


At RDT Engineers, our primary focus is our PEOPLE. We support our employees in professional and individual development. With our flat hierarchy, commitment and values, which inspire them to do their best. We pursue our PEOPLE’s work satisfaction and can guarantee highest quality, which leads to our second mission – our CLIENTS. We, our PEOPLE, provide engineering solutions that enable our customers to have a competitive advantage in efficiency, flexibility and costs.


Thanks to our PEOPLE, we have supplied the best engineering services since 2007 and offer the best and most flexible terms in the market for engineering services.


Be part of our missions and join RDT Engineers in Denmark.

  

  

  

### **GEOTECHNICAL DESIGN ENGINEER**

  


  

We are looking for a new colleague to join an exciting project with our client in the renewable industry.

  

Location: South Jutland, Denmark or Stockholm area, Sweden.  

  



  

  

##### **AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY**


* Provide technical support and guidance to project teams on geotechnical design issues
* Develop and implement geotechnical design procedures
* Participate in research programs to ensure Vattenfall stays up to date with the latest developments in the industry
* Lead and undertake foundation design tasks, specifically monopile foundations, using both PLAXIS and in-house developed tools
* Make foundation installation analyses using both commercial and in-house tools
* Prepare geotechnical design reports and other project related documents
* Collaborate with other disciplines, including structural, Loads and Site investigation
##### **QUALIFICATIONS & COMPETENCIES**


* A master's degree in Civil Engineering with a geotechnical specialization
* 5 to 10 years of relevant experience in geotechnical engineering
* Experience with offshore foundation design, preferably including monopile design experience
* Experience with foundation design using software similar to PLAXIS
* Proficiency in programming in MatLab and Python for interfaces with design software.
* A proactive and outgoing mindset, ability to take ownership over tasks and ensure timely delivery
* Familiarity with relevant codes and standards (e.g. API, DNV or ISO)
* Effective communication skills in English, both written and verbal
* The ability to work in a fast-paced and collaborative team environment
Valid EU work permit making you able to work in either Denmark or Sweden right away  
* 
  

  

##### **INTERESTED?**


If you are interested in / or have questions about the position, please contact us on:


denmark@rdtengineers.com
 (+45) 22315183
The position will be closed when we have found the right candidate, and we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. Notice only your CV in English is necessary.


##### **LOCATION**


South Jutland/Stockholm area , Denmark/Sweden  

  

  

##### **START DATE**


ASAP

title: Design Engineer – Child Bike Seats and Strollers to Thule...
description:
**- Join Thule’s Passionate Team and Make a Real Impact on the Safety and Comfort of Children! -**

*Do you have a passion for creating products that make a real difference in families lives? Are you excited about developing innovative, safe, and functional solutions for families who love outdoor adventures? If you're driven by the challenge of designing products that combine cutting-edge technology with the highest standards of safety and comfort for children, then this is the perfect opportunity for you!*


At **Thule**, we’re on a mission to help families explore the world with ease, knowing their children are secure and comfortable. We’re expanding our team to develop next-generation child bike seats and strollers that set the standard for safety, design, and usability. If you want to work in a company that values creativity and craftsmanship and where your work will have a lasting impact on families, this role is for you.


As a **Design Engineer for Child Bike Seats and Strollers**, you’ll have the unique opportunity to take part in designing solutions that help children explore the world from the back of a bike or in a stroller, knowing that every detail—from materials to ergonomics—has been carefully thought through to ensure their safety and comfort.

**Why Thule?**  

At Thule, we’re not just about building products; we’re about building trust. Parents trust us to deliver products that are as safe as they are functional, and that’s a responsibility we take seriously. We’ve invested heavily in state-of-the-art resources, including a modern prototype workshop, allowing you to bring your ideas to life quickly and efficiently. You’ll work alongside passionate, like-minded engineers and designers, all driven by the same goal: to make family life safer, easier, and more fun.

**What You’ll Be Doing:**

* Designing and developing **child bike seats** and **strollers** that meet Thule’s uncompromising standards for safety, comfort, and usability.
* Driving the product development cycle from ideation to industrialization, ensuring products meet Thule’s high-quality and safety standards, while being on time and within budget.
* Collaborating closely with cross-functional teams (designers, engineers, and project managers) to create solutions that exceed the expectations of families everywhere.
* Selecting the best materials and manufacturing techniques, always with a focus on durability, comfort, and sustainability.
* Conducting hands-on testing and prototyping to refine and perfect your designs, ensuring they deliver the best possible experience for both parents and children.

**What We’re Looking For:**

* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering (or equivalent experience) with a focus on design engineering or product development.
* Experience with SolidWorks or similar CAD software and an understanding of materials like plastics, metals, and textiles commonly used in child safety products.
* A passion for designing products that solve real-world problems for families, especially in the field of children’s safety.
* A collaborative mindset, eager to work in a multidisciplinary team and share ideas that push the boundaries of innovation.
* A strong commitment to quality and safety, with a keen eye for detail in design and testing.
* Fluency in English—it’s the main language we use for communication.

**About You:**

* You are passionate about creating safe, comfortable, and innovative products that will improve the lives of children and families.
* You are excited by the idea of being involved in the entire lifecycle of a product, from concept to market, with a focus on quality, usability, and design.
* You enjoy problem-solving and thrive in an environment where creative solutions are encouraged.
* You are motivated by the chance to leave a lasting impact on the products you design, knowing they will be part of families' everyday lives and adventures.
* You are proactive, self-driven, and eager to work in a dynamic and collaborative environment.

**About our Global Product Development Department**  

Globally we are over 250 engineers out of the majority is working in our Global Product Development Center in Hillerstorp (Sweden). Our cross functional team consists of highly skilled and motivated members with a well-balanced variety of experiences. We are a truly global company with an international and multi-cultural team. English is the language we use in our daily communication. We see a great future with continued passion for product development that is so vital for our growth as a company. We set great value in our working environment and offer great premises designed for product development. In our Global R&D center in Hillerstorp we have expanded with new offices, landscapes, team rooms and creative areas, but also great prototype areas including cut & sew and electronics lab.  

  

**Application**  

The role reports to our Manager Design Engineering Strollers & CBS, Simon Stråth (simon.strath@thule.com).  

Simon is available to answer detailed questions regarding the position by email.  

For more information about the recruitment process or the position, please contact the recruiter Fredrik Stigbäck at Fredrik.stigback@thule.com or +46732 360560.  

Please apply through our website at www.thulegroup.com/open-positions with your CV and cover letter.  

Do not wait until the last application date—interviews are held continuously during the process, and the position may be filled before the final deadline of January 12th, 2025.
